   19: %%
   20: -module(heart_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: %% Test suite exports
   25: -export([
   26:     all/0, suite/0,
   27:     init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1
   28: ]).
   29: 
   30: %% Test case exports
   31: -export([
   32:     start/0, start/1,
   33:     restart/0, restart/1,
   34:     reboot/0, reboot/1,
   35:     node_start_immediately_after_crash/1,
   36:     node_start_soon_after_crash/1,
   37:     set_cmd/1, clear_cmd/1, get_cmd/1,
   38:     callback_api/1, options_api/1, dont_drop/1,
   39:     kill_pid/0, kill_pid/1,
   40:     heart_no_kill/0, heart_no_kill/1
   41: ]).
   42: 
   43: %% Internal exports used by peer nodes
   44: -export([
   45:     start_heart_stress/1, mangle/1,
   46:     suicide_by_heart/0, non_suicide_by_heart/0,
   47:     exhaust_atoms/0
   48: ]).
   49: 
   50: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   51: %% Test suite for heart
   52: suite() ->
   53:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]}, {timetrap, {minutes,2}}].
   54: 
   55: all() ->
   56:     [
   57:         start, restart, reboot,
   58:         node_start_immediately_after_crash,
   59:         node_start_soon_after_crash,
   60:         set_cmd, clear_cmd, get_cmd, callback_api,
   61:         options_api, kill_pid, heart_no_kill].
   62: 
   63: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   64:     case os:type() of
   65:         {win32, windows} ->
   66:             {skipped, "No use to run on Windows 95/98"};
   67:         _ ->
   68:             ignore_cores:init(Config)
   69:     end.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     ignore_cores:fini(Config).
   73: 
   74: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   75: %% Test suite for heart
   76: 
   77: heart_args() ->
   78:     Common = ["-heart"],
   79:     case os:type() of
   80:         {win32, _} ->
   81:             Common ++ ["-env", "HEART_COMMAND", "no_reboot"];
   82:         _ ->
   83:             Common
   84:     end.
   85: 
   86: heart_monitor(Node) ->
   87:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
   88:     %% assert that peer node has a heart
   89:     is_pid(rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [heart])) orelse
   90:         ct:fail(heart_not_started),
   91:     ok.
   92: 
   93: start() ->
   94:     [{doc, "Test that node is down after init:reboot"}].
   95: 
   96: start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   97:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
   98:     heart_monitor(Node),
   99:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  100:     receive
  101:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  102:             ok
  103:     after
  104:         2000 -> ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  105:     end,
  106:     timer:sleep(5000),
  107:     net_adm:ping(Node) =:= pang orelse
  108:         ct:fail(node_rebooted).
  109: 
  110: restart() ->
  111:     [{doc, "Check that a node is up and running after a init:restart/0"}].
  112: 
  113: %% Also test fixed bug in R1B (it was not possible to
  114: %% do init:stop/0 on a restarted system before)
  115: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  116: %% Therefore the slave process has to be killed
  117: %% before restart.
  118: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io, args => heart_args()}),
  120:     heart_monitor(Node),
  121:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  122:     receive
  123: 	    {nodedown, Node} ->
  124: 	        ok
  125:     after 5000 ->
  126: 	    ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  127:     end,
  128:     timer:sleep(5000),
  129:     node_check_up_down(Node, 2000),
  130:     peer:stop(Peer).
  131: 
  132: reboot() ->
  133:     [{doc, "Check that a node is up and running after a init:reboot/0"}].
  134: 
  135: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  137:     heart_monitor(Node),
  138:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd,
  139:         [ct:get_progname() ++ " -noshell -heart " ++ name(Node) ++ "&"]),
  140:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  141:     receive
  142:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  143:             ok
  144:     after 2000 ->
  145: 	    ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  146:     end,
  147:     timer:sleep(5000),
  148:     node_check_up_down(Node, 2000),
  149:     ok.
  150: 
  151: %% node_start_immediately_after_crash
  152: %% Purpose:
  153: %%   Check that a node is up and running after a crash.
  154: %%   This test exhausts the atom table on the remote node.
  155: %%   ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS=0 will force beam not to dump an erl_crash.dump.
  156: %% May currently dump core in beam debug build due to lock-order violation
  157: %% This should be removed when a non-locked information retriever is implemented
  158: %% for crash dumps
  159: node_start_immediately_after_crash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, true),
  161:     try
  162:         node_start_immediately_after_crash_test(Config2)
  163:     after
  164:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  165:     end.
  166: 
  167: node_start_immediately_after_crash_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io,
  169:         args => heart_args() ++ ["-env", "ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS", "0"]}),
  170:     heart_monitor(Node),
  171: 
  172:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd,
  173:         [ct:get_progname() ++ " -noshell -heart " ++ name(Node) ++ "&"]),
  174: 
  175:     %% crash it with atom exhaustion
  176:     rpc:cast(Node, ?MODULE, exhaust_atoms, []),
  177: 
  178:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  179:     receive
  180:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  181:         Msec = erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - T0, native, millisecond),
  182:         io:format("Took ~.2f s. for node to go down~n", [Msec / 1000]),
  183:         ok
  184:     %% timeout is very liberal here. nodedown is received in about 1 s. on linux (palantir)
  185:     %% and in about 10 s. on solaris (carcharoth)
  186:     after (15000 * test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()) ->
  187:         ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  188:     end,
  189:     timer:sleep(3000),
  190:     node_check_up_down(Node, 2000).
  191: 
  192: %% node_start_soon_after_crash
  193: %% Purpose:
  194: %%   Check that a node is up and running after a crash.
  195: %%   This test exhausts the atom table on the remote node.
  196: %%   ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS=10 will force beam
  197: %%   to only dump an erl_crash.dump for 10 seconds.
  198: node_start_soon_after_crash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  199:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, true),
  200:     try
  201:         node_start_soon_after_crash_test(Config2)
  202:     after
  203:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  204:     end.
  205: 
  206: node_start_soon_after_crash_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io,
  208:         args => heart_args() ++ ["-env", "ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS", "10"]}),
  209:     heart_monitor(Node),
  210: 
  211:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd,
  212:         [ct:get_progname() ++ " -noshell -heart " ++ name(Node) ++ "&"]),
  213: 
  214:     rpc:cast(Node, ?MODULE, exhaust_atoms, []),
  215: 
  216:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok
  217:     after (15000 * test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()) -> ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  218:     end,
  219:     timer:sleep(20000),
  220:     node_check_up_down(Node, 15000).
  221: 
  222: 
  223: node_check_up_down(Node, Tmo) ->
  224:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  225:         pong ->
  226:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  227:             rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  228:             receive
  229:                 {nodedown, Node} -> ok
  230:             after Tmo ->
  231:                 ct:fail(node_not_closed2)
  232:             end;
  233:         _ ->
  234:             ct:fail(node_not_rebooted)
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: %% Only tests bad command, correct behaviour is tested in reboot/1.
  238: set_cmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  240:     heart_monitor(Node),
  241:     Cmd = wrong_atom,
  242:     {error, {bad_cmd, Cmd}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [Cmd]),
  243:     Cmd1 = lists:duplicate(2047, $a),
  244:     {error, {bad_cmd, Cmd1}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [Cmd1]),
  245:     Cmd2 = lists:duplicate(28, $a),
  246:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [Cmd2]),
  247:     Cmd3 = lists:duplicate(2000, $a),
  248:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [Cmd3]),
  249:     peer:stop(Peer),
  250:     ok.
  251: 
  252: clear_cmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  253:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  254:     heart_monitor(Node),
  255:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd,
  256:         [ct:get_progname() ++
  257:             " -noshell -heart " ++ name(Node) ++ "&"]),
  258:     rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  259:     receive
  260:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  261:             ok
  262:     after 2000 ->
  263:         ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  264:     end,
  265:     timer:sleep(5000),
  266:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  267:         pong ->
  268:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, true);
  269:         _ ->
  270:             ct:fail(node_not_rebooted)
  271:     end,
  272:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd,
  273:         ["erl -noshell -heart " ++ name(Node) ++ "&"]),
  274:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, clear_cmd, []),
  275:     rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  276:     receive
  277:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  278:             ok
  279:     after 2000 ->
  280:         ct:fail(node_not_closed)
  281:     end,
  282:     timer:sleep(5000),
  283:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  284:         pang ->
  285:             ok;
  286:         _ ->
  287:             ct:fail(node_rebooted)
  288:     end,
  289:     ok.
  290: 
  291: get_cmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  293:     heart_monitor(Node),
  294: 
  295:     ShortCmd = "test",
  296:     ok  = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [ShortCmd]),
  297:     {ok, ShortCmd} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_cmd, []),
  298: 
  299:     %% This would hang prior to OTP-15024 being fixed.
  300:     LongCmd = [$a || _ <- lists:seq(1, 160)],
  301:     ok  = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_cmd, [LongCmd]),
  302:     {ok, LongCmd} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_cmd, []),
  303: 
  304:     peer:stop(Peer),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: callback_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  309:     heart_monitor(Node),
  310:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  311:     M0 = self(),
  312:     F0 = ok,
  313:     {error, {bad_callback, {M0,F0}}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_callback, [M0,F0]),
  314:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  315:     M1 = lists:duplicate(28, $a),
  316:     F1 = lists:duplicate(28, $b),
  317:     {error, {bad_callback, {M1,F1}}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_callback, [M1,F1]),
  318:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  319: 
  320:     M2 = heart_check_module,
  321:     F2 = cb_ok,
  322:     F3 = cb_error,
  323:     Code0 = generate(M2, [], [
  324: 	    atom_to_list(F2) ++ "() -> ok.",
  325:             atom_to_list(F3) ++ "() -> exit(\"callback_error (as intended)\")."
  326: 	]),
  327:     {module, M2} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, load_module, [M2, Code0]),
  328:     ok = rpc:call(Node, M2, F2, []),
  329:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_callback, [M2,F2]),
  330:     {ok, {M2,F2}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  331:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, clear_callback, []),
  332:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  333:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_callback, [M2,F2]),
  334:     {ok, {M2,F2}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_callback, []),
  335:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_callback, [M2,F3]),
  336:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok
  337:     after 5000 -> ct:fail(node_not_killed)
  338:     end,
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: options_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  343:     heart_monitor(Node),
  344:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  345:     M0 = self(),
  346:     F0 = ok,
  347:     {error, {bad_options, {M0,F0}}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [{M0,F0}]),
  348:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  349:     Ls = lists:duplicate(28, $b),
  350:     {error, {bad_options, Ls}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [Ls]),
  351:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  352: 
  353:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [[check_schedulers]]),
  354:     {ok, [check_schedulers]} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  355:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [[]]),
  356:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  357: 
  358:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [[check_schedulers]]),
  359:     {ok, [check_schedulers]} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  360:     {error, {bad_options, Ls}} = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [Ls]),
  361:     {ok, [check_schedulers]} = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  362: 
  363:     receive after 3000 -> ok end, %% wait 3 secs
  364: 
  365:     ok = rpc:call(Node, heart, set_options, [[]]),
  366:     none = rpc:call(Node, heart, get_options, []),
  367:     peer:stop(Peer),
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: 
  371: %%% Removed as it may crash epmd/distribution in colourful
  372: %%% ways. While we ARE finding out WHY, it would
  373: %%% be nice for others to be able to run the kernel test suite
  374: %%% without "exploding machines", so that's why I removed it for now.
  375: 
  376: %% Tests that the heart command does not get dropped when
  377: %% set just before halt on very high I/O load..
  378: dont_drop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  379:     %%% Have to do it some times to make it happen...
  380:     [ok,ok,ok,ok,ok,ok,ok,ok,ok,ok] = do_dont_drop(Config,10),
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: do_dont_drop(_,0) -> [];
  384: do_dont_drop(Config,N) ->
  385:     %% Name of first slave node
  386:     NN1 = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "slave_1",
  387:     %% Name of node started by heart on failure
  388:     NN2 = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "slave_2",
  389:     %% Name of node started by heart on success
  390:     NN3 = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "slave_3",
  391:     Host = hd(tl(string:tokens(atom_to_list(node()),"@"))),
  392:     %% The initial heart command
  393:     FirstCmd = erl() ++ name(NN2 ++ "@" ++ Host),
  394:     %% Separated the parameters to start_node_run for clarity...
  395:     Name = list_to_atom(NN1),
  396:     EchoPath = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "simple_echo"),
  397:     Peer3Name = list_to_atom(NN3 ++ "@" ++ Host),
  398:     %%
  399:     PA = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  400:     Params = ["-heart", "-pa", PA, "-env", "HEART_COMMAND", FirstCmd],
  401:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => Name, args => Params}),
  402:     peer:call(Peer, ?MODULE, start_heart_stress, [Peer3Name, EchoPath]),
  403:     %%
  404:     case wait_for_any_of(list_to_atom(NN2 ++ "@" ++ Host),
  405: 	    list_to_atom(NN3 ++ "@" ++ Host)) of
  406: 	2 ->
  407: 	    [ok | do_dont_drop(Config,N-1)];
  408: 	_ ->
  409: 	    false
  410:     end.
  411: 
  412: wait_for_any_of(N1,N2) ->
  413:     wait_for_any_of(N1,N2,45).
  414: 
  415: wait_for_any_of(_N1,_N2,0) ->
  416:     false;
  417: 
  418: wait_for_any_of(N1,N2,Times) ->
  419:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  420:     case net_adm:ping(N1) of
  421: 	pang ->
  422: 	    case net_adm:ping(N2) of
  423: 		pang ->
  424: 		    wait_for_any_of(N1,N2,Times - 1);
  425: 		pong ->
  426: 		    rpc:call(N2,init,stop,[]),
  427: 		    2
  428: 	    end;
  429: 	pong ->
  430: 	    rpc:call(N1,init,stop,[]),
  431: 	    1
  432:     end.
  433: 
  434: 
  435: kill_pid() ->
  436:     [{doc, "Tests that heart kills the old erlang node before executing heart command."}].
  437: 
  438: kill_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     {ok, _Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args() ++ ["-env", "HEART_COMMAND", "nickeNyfikenFarEttJobb"]),
  440:     heart_monitor(Node),
  441:     true = rpc:cast(Node, ?MODULE, suicide_by_heart, []),
  442:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  443:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok
  444:     after 30000 ->
  445:         ct:fail(heart_did_not_kill_old_node)
  446:     end.
  447: 
  448: 
  449: heart_no_kill() ->
  450:     [{doc, "Tests that heart doesn't kill the old erlang node when HEART_NO_KILL is set."}].
  451: 
  452: heart_no_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  453:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(heart_args()),
  454:     heart_monitor(Node),
  455:     true = rpc:cast(Node, ?MODULE, non_suicide_by_heart, []),
  456:     receive
  457:         {nodedown, Node} ->
  458:             ct:fail(heart_killed_old_node)
  459:     after 30000 ->
  460:         peer:stop(Peer)
  461:     end.
  462: 
  463: erl() ->	   
  464:     case os:type() of
  465: 	{win32,_} -> "werl ";
  466: 	_ -> "erl "
  467:     end.
  468: 
  469: name(Node) when is_list(Node) -> name(Node, []);
  470: name(Node) when is_atom(Node) -> name(atom_to_list(Node), []).
  471: 
  472: name([$@ | Node], Name) ->
  473:     case lists:member($., Node) of
  474:         true ->
  475:             "-name " ++ lists:reverse(Name);
  476:         _ ->
  477:             "-sname " ++ lists:reverse(Name)
  478:     end;
  479: name([H | T], Name) ->
  480:     name(T, [H | Name]).
  481: 
  482: 
  483: %%% This code is run in a peer node to ensure that
  484: %%% A heart command really gets set synchronously
  485: %%% and cannot get "dropped".
  486: 
  487: send_to(_, _, 0) ->
  488:     ok;
  489: send_to(Port, D, N) ->
  490:     Port ! {self(), {command, D}},
  491:     send_to(Port, D, N - 1).
  492: 
  493: receive_from(_, _, 0) ->
  494:     ok;
  495: 
  496: receive_from(Port, D, N) ->
  497:     receive
  498:         {Port, {data, {eol, _Data}}} ->
  499:             receive_from(Port, D, N - 1);
  500:         X ->
  501:             io:format("Got garbage ~p~n", [X])
  502:     end.
  503: 
  504: mangle(PP) when is_list(PP) ->
  505:     Port = open_port({spawn, PP}, [{line, 100}]),
  506:     mangle(Port);
  507: 
  508: mangle(Port) ->
  509:     send_to(Port, "ABCDEFGHIJ" ++ io_lib:nl(), 1),
  510:     receive_from(Port, "ABCDEFGHIJ", 1),
  511:     mangle(Port).
  512: 
  513: 
  514: 
  515: explode(0, _) ->
  516:     ok;
  517: explode(N, PP) ->
  518:     spawn(?MODULE, mangle, [PP]),
  519:     explode(N - 1, PP).
  520: 
  521: start_heart_stress([NewName, PortProgram]) ->
  522:     explode(10, atom_to_list(PortProgram)),
  523:     NewCmd = erl() ++ name(NewName),
  524:     %%io:format("~p~n",[NewCmd]),
  525:     receive
  526:     after 10000 ->
  527:         heart:set_cmd(NewCmd),
  528:         halt()
  529:     end.
  530: 
  531: suicide_by_heart() ->
  532:     %%io:format("Suicide starting...~n"),
  533:     open_port({spawn, "heart -ht 11 -pid " ++ os:getpid()}, [{packet, 2}]),
  534:     receive X -> X end,
  535:     %% Just hang and wait for heart to timeout
  536:     receive
  537:         {makaronipudding} ->
  538:             sallad
  539:     end.
  540: 
  541: non_suicide_by_heart() ->
  542:     P = open_port({spawn, "heart -ht 11 -pid " ++ os:getpid()},
  543:         [exit_status, {env, [{"HEART_NO_KILL", "TRUE"}]},
  544:             {packet, 2}]),
  545:     receive X -> X end,
  546:     %% Just hang and wait for heart to timeout
  547:     receive
  548:         {P, {exit_status, _}} ->
  549:             ok
  550:     after
  551:         20000 ->
  552:             exit(timeout)
  553:     end.
  554: 
  555: exhaust_atoms() ->
  556:     Set = lists:seq($a,$z),
  557:     [list_to_atom([A,B,C,D,E]) || A <- Set, B <- Set, C <- Set, E <- Set, D <- Set].
  558: 
  559: %% generate a module from binary
  560: generate(Module, Attributes, FunStrings) ->
  561:     FunForms = function_forms(FunStrings),
  562:     Forms = [
  563:         {attribute, a(1), module, Module},
  564:         {attribute, a(2), export, [FA || {FA, _} <- FunForms]}
  565:     ] ++ [{attribute, a(3), A, V} || {A, V} <- Attributes] ++
  566:         [Function || {_, Function} <- FunForms],
  567:     {ok, Module, Bin} = compile:forms(Forms),
  568:     Bin.
  569: 
  570: a(L) ->
  571:     erl_anno:new(L).
  572: 
  573: function_forms([]) -> [];
  574: function_forms([S | Ss]) ->
  575:     {ok, Ts, _} = erl_scan:string(S),
  576:     {ok, Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
  577:     Fun = element(3, Form),
  578:     Arity = element(4, Form),
  579:     [{{Fun, Arity}, Form} | function_forms(Ss)].
